definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Each nationality has its own language of posture and gesture.
sentences.chinese: 每个民族都有自己的身势语和手势语。

sentences.english: The point is that it alerts you to something that is being withheld.
sentences.chinese: 重要的是，这个手势提醒了你事有隐情。

sentences.english: She resembles her mother in the way she moves her hands when she talks.
sentences.chinese: 她说话时打手势的动作像她妈妈。

sentences.english: But neither girl by word or gesture revealed her blankness.
sentences.chinese: 但是没有一个姑娘用说话或者手势来表达她们的惆怅。

sentences.english: Papo furado is typically a gesture made behind the back of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 这个手势通常要在聊天中的一个主题之后使用。

sentences.english: Hand gestures are commonly known as Mudras in Odissi dancing.
sentences.chinese: 手势通常被称为奥迪西手印在跳舞。

sentences.english: There was a laugh which he cut off brusquely with a gesture.
sentences.chinese: 人们发出一阵哄笑，他做了个手势，猛然制止了笑声。

sentences.english: Gabriel giggled and waved bye-bye back to him.
sentences.chinese: 盖布瑞尔吃吃的笑著并回以挥手再见的手势。

sentences.english: He is all flourishes, rococo gestures, and exquisite manners.
sentences.chinese: 他手舞足蹈，优雅地比划着繁杂的手势。

sentences.english: Various animation effects initiated by touch, swipes and other gestures.
sentences.chinese: 各种动画效果开始通过触摸，挥笔等手势。

sentences.english: I gestured towards the boathouse, and he looked inside.
sentences.chinese: 我对着船库比了个手势，他向里面看去。

sentences.english: He only uses the hand signal and she converses, Possible she to be able to read his each look.
sentences.chinese: 它只用手势和她交谈，可能她能读懂他的每一个眼神。

sentences.english: Additionally, support for gestures in Compiz may also be included.
sentences.chinese: 此外，Compiz可能会支持手势识别。

sentences.english: I answer with prearranged hand signals.
sentences.chinese: 我用事先安排好的手势作答。

sentences.english: Every gesture of the conductor is subject to a certain level of interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 指挥的每一个手势都代表了一种演奏法。

sentences.english: We gesture because it’s part of our lexicon.
sentences.chinese: 我们打手势是因为它是我们语言的一部分。

definition: to hint/to indicate (an idea to sb)
to gesture/to gesticulate/to practice the moves of a martial art by imitating the teacher/to fight/to come to blows
wry face/to grimace/to pull a face/comic face/face mask/devil mask
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
to raise a hand/to put up one's hand (as signal)
to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
to understand tacitly (idiom)/to know intuitively/to understand thoroughly
